verses.meaning: She is the auspicious Mother (Śrīmātā), the great Empress (Śrīmahārājñī), the sovereign seated on the magnificent throne (Śrīmatsiṃhāsaneśvarī). She is born from the fire-pit of pure consciousness (Cidagnikuṇḍasambhūtā), ever ready to fulfill the tasks of the gods (Devakāryasamudyatā).

She shines with the brilliance of a thousand rising suns (Udyadbhānusahasrābhā), possessing four arms (Caturbāhusamanvitā). She holds the noose in the form of desire (Rāgasvarūpapāśāḍhyā), and the radiant goad representing anger (Krodhākārāṅkuśojjvalā).

She holds a bow of sugarcane representing the mind (Manorūpekṣukodaṇḍā), with five arrows made of the five subtle elements (Pañcatanmātrasāyakā). The entire universe is immersed in the flood of Her rosy radiance (Nijāruṇaprabhāpūramajjadbrahmāṇḍamaṇḍalā).

Her hair is adorned with fragrant champaka, ashoka, punnaga and lotus flowers (Campakāśokapunnāgasaugandhikalasatkacā). She is decorated with a crown studded with rows of rubies and precious gems (Kuruvindamaṇiśreṇīkanatkotīramaṇḍitā).
Her forehead shines with the splendor of the eighth-day moon (Aṣṭamīcandravibhrājadalikasthalaśobhitā). She wears a mark of musk on Her moon-like face (Mukhacandrakalaṅkābhamṛganābhiviśeṣakā).
